item.title: 西姆库斯称欧洲央行应保持一致的降息步伐
item.description: 欧洲中央银行理事会成员吉迪米纳斯-西姆库斯（Gediminas Simkus）认为，随着通胀日益受到控制，欧洲中央银行应继续以目前的速度降低借贷成本。【原文：The European Central Bank should keep lowering borrowing costs at the current pace as inflation is increasingly under control, according to Governing Council member Gediminas Simkus.】

item.title: 挪威维持利率稳定并发出三月首次降息的信号
item.description: 挪威央行将借贷成本维持在16年来的高位不变，并表示很有可能在2025年3月降低关键利率。【原文：Norway’s central bank held its borrowing costs unchanged at a 16-year high and said the key rate will most likely be reduced in March 2025.】

item.title: 妮娜-阿查吉安谈当前在风险投资领域取胜的关键所在
item.description:
如何在不断变化的市场中取得成功。【原文：

How to succeed in a changing market.

】

item.title: 奇货可居：妮娜-阿查吉安谈赢得风险投资的关键（播客）
item.description: 奇货可居：妮娜-阿查吉安谈赢得风险投资的关键（播客）【原文：Odd Lots: Nina Achadjian on What It Takes to Win in VC (Podcast)】

item.title: 英国 10 年期国债收益率在英国央行会议前升至一年多以来最高点
item.description: 在美联储主席杰罗姆-鲍威尔（Jerome Powell）对决策者继续降低借贷成本的速度发出更加谨慎的信号后，隔夜英国国债暴跌，追上了美国国债的激进抛售。【原文：UK government bonds tumbled, catching up with an aggressive selloff in US Treasuries overnight after Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell signaled greater caution over how quickly policymakers can continue reducing borrowing costs.】

item.title: 瑞典央行降息四分之一个百分点，宽松政策接近尾声
item.description: 瑞典央行将基准利率下调了 25 个基点，并表示其宽松政策可能即将结束，只剩下一次降息部署。【原文：Sweden’s Riksbank lowered its benchmark interest rate by 25 basis points and signaled its easing campaign is likely to be wrapping up with one cut left to deploy.】

item.title: 俄罗斯新哈特金斯克炼油厂遭无人机袭击后起火
item.description: 据一名地区官员称，无人机在一夜之间袭击了靠近乌克兰边境的俄罗斯新沙赫廷斯克炼油厂。【原文：An overnight drone attack set fire to Russia’s Novoshakhtinsk refinery near the border with Ukraine, according to a regional official.】

item.title: 边缘》称纳吉布-拉扎克的妻子洗钱罪名不成立
item.description: 马来西亚前总理纳吉布-拉扎克（Najib Razak）的妻子罗斯玛-曼苏尔（Rosmah Mansor）在其洗钱和逃税案中被判完全无罪，这是与该国执政党之一有关联的个人在法律上取得的最新胜利。【原文：Rosmah Mansor, the wife of Malaysia’s former Prime Minister Najib Razak, was granted a full acquittal in her money-laundering and tax evasion case, in the latest legal victory for individuals linked to one of the country’s ruling parties.】

item.title: 苹果公司接近获得印尼批准终止 iPhone 16 禁售令
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，在印尼总统普拉博沃-苏比安托（Prabowo Subianto）批准政府接受这家美国科技巨头 10 亿美元的投资后，苹果公司即将获得印尼取消 iPhone 16 销售禁令的许可。【原文：Apple Inc. is close to getting Indonesia to lift its ban on iPhone 16 sales, after President Prabowo Subianto gave his approval for the government to accept a $1 billion investment from the US tech giant, according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 菲律宾发售 9 美元债券推动债券市场扩张
item.description: 菲律宾正在加紧出售低至 500 比索（9 美元）的政府证券，以扩大投资者基础，帮助为亚洲增长最快的经济体之一提供资金。【原文：The Philippines is ramping up the sale of government securities for as low as 500 pesos ($9) in a bid to broaden the investor base and help fund one of Asia’s fastest-growing economies.】

item.title: 家庭用水紧张，英国水费将在 5 年内上涨 36
item.description: 未来五年，英格兰和威尔士的水费将上涨 36%，这给已经感受到水价上涨压力的家庭带来了更大的压力。【原文：Water bills are set to rise by 36% in England and Wales over the next five years, piling pressure on households already feeling the sting of higher prices.】

item.title: 低廉的英国股票将在明年为乐观主义者平反
item.description: 英国股票多头等待 2025 年的平反，因为诱人的折扣和大额股东派息将提振市场。【原文：UK stock bulls await vindication in 2025 as an enticing discount and large shareholder payouts are set to lift the market.】

item.title: 英国水务管理局表示，泰晤士河水务股权投资者将获得 5.1% 的回报率
item.description: 泰晤士河水务公司的股权投资者将在未来五年内获得 5.1% 的回报率，这是这家负债累累的公司在努力维持运营过程中的一个关键监管指标。【原文：Thames Water equity investors will get a return of 5.1% over the next five years, a key regulatory marker for the heavily indebted company as it scrambles to stay afloat.】

item.title: 受供应前景影响，小麦将出现自 6 月份以来最长的连续亏损
item.description: 小麦因预期供应充足和美元走强而出现五个多月来最长的连续下跌。【原文：Wheat headed for the longest run of declines in more than five months on expectations for ample supply and a stronger dollar.】

item.title: 菲律宾下调主要利率，将继续保持宽松政策
item.description: 菲律宾中央银行在连续第三次会议上将政策利率下调了四分之一个百分点，并表示在通胀保持在目标水平、经济增长放缓之后，将继续采取有节制的宽松政策。【原文：The Philippine central bank lowered its policy rate by a quarter point for the third straight meeting and said it intends to maintain a measured approach to easing, after inflation stayed on target and economic growth slowed.】

item.title: 韩国贷款机构将在动荡中清理大量房地产贷款
item.description: 由于韩国的政治动荡损害了经济增长，韩国金融市场监管机构正加大对贷款机构的压力，要求其清理问题房地产贷款。【原文：South Korea’s financial market regulator is increasing pressure on lenders to clean up troubled real estate loans as the nation’s political turmoil hurts economic growth.】

item.title: 富时 100 指数直播：美联储引发大跌后英国股市将下滑
Kazakhstan Targets $1 Billion in Venture Fund to Attract Startups
item.description: Kazakhstan’s government unveiled plans to target $1 billion in investment to help regional startups and cutting-edge technologies by launching a venture capital fund of funds next year.

item.title: 美国海军上将称特朗普不会改变美国的越南政策
item.description: 美国印度洋-太平洋司令部司令在河内举行的一次情况通报会上说，在即将上任的特朗普政府执政期间，美国很可能会继续其目前的政策，让越南参与军事行动和活动。【原文：The US will most likely continue its current policy of engaging Vietnam in military operations and activities during the incoming Trump administration, the head of US Indo-Pacific Command said at a briefing in Hanoi.】

item.title: 美联储为特朗普市场的圣诞节投下一块煤炭
item.description:
鲍威尔驳斥了关税影响削减幅度的说法，但摊牌可能迫在眉睫。【原文：

Powell rebuffs notion that tariffs weighed on calculations for fewer cuts, but a showdown may be looming.

】

item.title: Segantii 创始人萨德勒承认内幕交易无罪
item.description: 对冲基金公司 Segantii Capital Management 及其创始人西蒙-赛德勒（Simon Sadler）不承认内幕交易罪，为该案在香港开庭审理铺平了道路。【原文：Hedge fund firm Segantii Capital Management and its founder Simon Sadler have pleaded not guilty to insider trading, paving the way for the case to go to trial in Hong Kong.】

item.title: 日产汽车股价大涨令亚洲最大汽车制造商的交易员焦灼不安
item.description: 对于押注日产汽车公司的交易员来说，本周是痛苦的一周，该公司是亚洲被做空最多的汽车制造商，因为在与更强劲的竞争对手本田汽车公司（Honda Motor Co.【原文：It’s been a painful week for traders betting against Nissan Motor Co., Asia’s most shorted automaker, as its shares soared more than 30% in two days after merger talks with stronger rival Honda Motor Co. emerged.】

item.title: 欧洲汽车销量下滑，汽车制造商与消费放缓作斗争
item.description: 上个月，欧洲汽车销量下滑，该地区最大的汽车制造商正努力应对需求放缓引发的行业危机。【原文：European car sales sank last month as the region’s biggest automakers grapple with a slowdown in demand that’s triggered an industry crisis.】

item.title: 欧洲医疗保健股迎接被美国政治阴云笼罩的一年
item.description: 在 2024 年的最后几个月里，欧洲医疗保健股跌落谷底，在新的一年里面临着美国政治的威胁和新药试验结果的高风险。【原文：After falling off their perch in the last few months of 2024, European healthcare stocks head into a new year facing the jeopardy of US politics and high-stakes trial results for new drugs.】

item.title: 英国最低工资标准因错误统计数据的改变而提高
item.description: 由于支撑最低工资标准的统计数据方法有误，英国最低工资标准每小时提高了 14 便士（18 美分）。【原文：The UK’s minimum wage has been pushed up by 14 pence (18 cents) an hour as a result of changes to a faulty methodology in statistics that underpin the rate.】

item.title: 韩国与国民年金将扩大外汇互换规模至 650 亿美元
item.description: 韩国央行与国家养老金管理局达成一致，同意扩大货币互换交易的规模和期限，此举可能有助于减缓韩元的跌势。【原文：South Korea’s central bank agreed with the National Pension Service to expand the size and duration of a currency swap deal, a move that may help slow the won’s decline.】

item.title: Glencore 为新加坡 Bukom 工厂增购中东石油
item.description: 据交易商称，随着嘉能可公司（Glencore Plc）开始为新加坡 Bukom 炼油厂采购原油，该公司已成为本月中东现货石油货物的活跃买家。【原文：Glencore Plc has emerged as an active buyer of spot oil cargoes from the Middle East this month, as the merchant starts procuring crude for the Bukom refinery in Singapore, according to traders.】

item.title: 亚洲交易商认为 2025 年将有更多首次公开募股和可转换债券
item.description: 投资银行家们寄希望于亚洲的首次公开募股能在 2025 年的股权资本市场交易量中占据更大份额，而此前由于中国的交易量依然低迷，亚洲的首次公开募股交易降至八年来的最小比例。【原文：Investment bankers are pinning hopes on initial public offerings in Asia to grab a bigger slice of equity capital markets volumes in 2025, after such transactions fell to the smallest proportion in eight years as Chinese deals remained muted.】

item.title: 中石化称 2025 年起中国汽油需求将快速下降
item.description: 中国最大的炼油企业表示，中国的汽油需求已于去年达到顶峰，随着向电动汽车转变的步伐加快，汽油需求将加速下降。【原文：China’s biggest oil refiner said the country’s gasoline demand had peaked last year and declines would accelerate as the shift to electric vehicles gathers pace.】

item.title: 策略师称日元前景因日本央行不加息而恶化
item.description: 据策略师称，在日本央行跳过可能的加息之后，日元的前景正在恶化，而央行的经济声明可以被视为有些鸽派。【原文：The yen’s outlook is deteriorating after the Bank of Japan skipped a potential rate hike, while the central bank’s economic statement can be seen as somewhat dovish, according to strategists.】
